item.title: New Evangelion Series in the Works from NieR's Yoko Taro
item.content:encoded:
A new Evangelion series is on the way, and NieR auteur Yoko Taro will be penning it, with that series' composer Keiichi Okabe also providing the music.

The news was announced via the official Evangelion website as part of the iconic anime series' 30th anniversary celebrations. We're using machine translation for the article announcing the Evangelion revival.

Yoko Taro will be scripting the series, with production being handled by CloverWorks and Rebuild of Evangelion outfit Studio Khara. Keiichi Okabe, who's written music not only for NieR but also for its predecessor series Drakengard (as well as Hyrule Warriors and more), will be on composition duties.

Direction will be handled by Rebuild of Evangelion's Kazuya Tsurumaki and Chainsaw Man's Toko Yatabe, but beyond the staffers mentioned, we don't know much else about the new Evangelion series, including whether it'll be a reworked version of the original or an entirely new story.

What we do know, however, is that Yoko Taro has spoken in the past about how Evangelion influenced his work, and it's not hard to see how; like Evangelion, Taro's work combines high-octane action with deep philosophical themes (and, some might say, similarly nonsensical endings).

Whether or not production of the new Evangelion affects Taro and Okabe's work on NieR remains to be seen. It's worth noting that a new NieR game hasn't been released for around nine years; the last was 2017's NieR: Automata.

However, there may be cause to hope on that front. In a recent trailer announcing 10 million sales for the game, a closing message simply read "NieR: Automata to be continued...", suggesting that more NieR (and perhaps even more Automata) could be on the way.

We'll likely have to wait a little while before we get more information about Yoko Taro's plans for Evangelion, and, indeed, his plans for NieR as well. Stay tuned for more.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He‚Äôs originally an‚Ä¶ More about Joseph

item.title: Speculative Betting, Last-Minute Bidding And Crypto Baggage: Logan Paul‚Äôs Sale Of The World‚Äôs Most Expensive Pok√©mon Card Has Left A Lot Of Questions
item.content:encoded:
Logan Paul‚Äôs sale of the Illustrator Pikachu card last weekend made a lot of headlines, but they were almost entirely based on the extraordinary $16.5 million price paid for the plastic-cased piece of cardboard. However, what surrounds the sale, and the use of prediction market gambling, might perhaps be the real story.

Before we get started, let‚Äôs be completely clear: we‚Äôre not accusing anyone mentioned of wrongdoing. Lots of questions are being asked, and we are interested in finding out their answers.

On February 15, a weeks-long auction of Logan Paul‚Äôs Pok√©mon card collection came to an end, with winning bids exceeding the market prices for the listed cards by sometimes as much as 70 times. The standout among them was the PSA 10 Illustrator Pikachu, one of only 41 of the card ever printed, and the only one to have been graded a perfect 10; it sold for a record-smashing $16,492,000. That, of course, caused headlines around the world, as it was the most expensive collectible card sale of all time, fetching over three times more than any Pok√©mon card has ever sold for before.

Unusually, the winning bidder for the card has been identified. It‚Äôs AJ Scaramucci, the venture capitalist son of financier and former White House communications director Anthony Scaramucci, who bought the card for $13.3 million, and then paid the extra $3.2 million in auction house Goldin‚Äôs fees. Even more unusually, Scaramucci is said to have ‚Äúsurprised‚Äù Goldin by being in the company‚Äôs headquarters in person at the moment the sale completed. As Goldin put it in a press release, ‚ÄúOriginally, Paul agreed to personally visit the winning bidder to hand-deliver the card; however, the winner shocked the crowd with his presence as he was already at Goldin HQ.‚Äù Thus there was the opportunity for a photoshoot with Paul and Scaramucci as the card was handed over, still attached to its garish chain as worn during Wrestlemania.

Cutting It Close

The obvious question is: why? Why did someone pay quite so much money for something that has no intrinsic value beyond being collectible. The answer, in so many directions, is money. Paul paid $5.275 million for the card in 2022 in an attention-seeking move, and obviously wanted to profit from that stunt. Scaramucci said he thought the card would one day be worth $100 million, so he presumably sees it as an investment. Goldin got to charge a seven-figure fee for hosting a page on their website for a bit. But even after all this, there was more money to be made.

The card started its final night of the auction at $6.3 million, where it had sat throughout the final week of the 42-day auction, a modest increase from the massively over-inflated price Paul paid for the card four years ago. During this last day of bidding it rose to $6.882 million, where it stayed until the last moment. Auctioneers Goldin had predicted the card would sell for between $7 million and $12 million, and had already advanced Paul $2.5 million ahead of the sale (this was featured as part of the Netflix vanity documentary King of Collectibles), so hopes were that it would still climb a little higher. Then, at the last moment, a flurry of bids came in during ‚Äúan extended bidding period‚Äù when it suddenly shot up ten million to the unimaginable price of $16.5 million.

Obviously, anyone who‚Äôs tried to buy something desirable on eBay is used to seeing prices skyrocket in the closing few minutes, but this was quite extraordinary. Fortunately, Guinness World Records were in the room to capture the record-breaking moment.

Speculative Betting

Attention then turns to Polymarket, the cryptocurrency-based prediction market where people can bet on absolutely anything they wish, so long as it‚Äôs in the future. Ahead of the final day, Polymarket was predicting a 72 percent chance the card would sell for over $7 million, meaning had it sold for the $6.882 million it was sitting at before the extended bidding, a lot of people would have been disappointed.

However, Polymarket‚Äôs odds flipped much more in the better‚Äôs favor the moment that price went over $10 million. At $8m it sat at 61 percent, but at $10m that dropped to 40 percent. And as for $15 million: surely only a fool would have taken the odds of 11 percent. Because as Oddschecker put it at the time, ‚ÄúThis would require a historic bidding war and a sale far above Goldin‚Äôs top estimate of $12 million. Traders view this as a long-shot outcome.‚Äù

So that worked out rather well for the person who won $265,217 betting it would hit super-high prices, especially given it was the account‚Äôs first ever and only Polymarket bet. In total, five bets were placed by the account:

$98,814 at 58 percent for going over $10 million
$154,967 at 42 percent for going over $12m
$131,164 at 17 percent for going over $15 million
$195 at an unknown percentage for going over $18 million
$1,187 at an unknown percentage for going over $20 million

This could look like the betting of a person who felt extremely confident that the price was going to hit between $12 and $15 million, and pretty certain it wasn‚Äôt going to reach $18 million, but figured it‚Äôd look suspicious if they didn‚Äôt put a bet there anyway.

Someone just won $265K correctly predicting the sale price of @LoganPaul‚Äôs Pok√©mon Illustrator card.

This was his first and only bet ever on Polymarket.

What did he know? pic.twitter.com/rQA3p5jDNZ

‚Äî Car (@CarOnPolymarket) February 16, 2026

A few people have since raised questions about this, like X user @surgieboi who specializes in eBay actions of sports and TCG collectibles. Replying to Goldin‚Äôs CEO Ken Goldin‚Äôs boasting during the successful night (along with the most awkward video) as the price went over $13 million ‚ÄúAND RISING,‚Äù surgieboi asked, ‚ÄúWas it rising before your $4,000,000 estimate pre-auction (screenshot attached of your own data), or after Logan, I mean the anonymous Polymarket account bet that the auction would cross $15,000,000?‚Äù

Was it rising before your $4,000,000 estimate pre-auction (screenshot attached of your own data), or after Logan, I mean the anonymous Polymarket account bet that the auction would cross $15,000,000?

Coincidentally, aligning one-to-one with this latest content push. I‚Äôm‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/CxR9ai7LDH

‚Äî ùñòùñöùñóùñåùñéùñäùñáùñîùñé (@surgieboi) February 16, 2026

The reference to the $4 million figure comes from data embedded in Goldin‚Äôs website that shows the card was listed with ‚Äúestimated_value: 4000000.‚Äù It‚Äôs unclear if this is just a placeholder or something official, and we‚Äôve reached out to Goldin to ask. And indeed whether the auction house has any concerns regarding the Polymarket betting. And just to be clear, we‚Äôre in no way endorsing the many claims made by surgieboi in his post.

Liquidated Marketplace

This is not the first controversy surrounding the Illustrator Pikachu card since Logan Paul bought it, and a previous issue came back to bite him after the sale. Keen as the amateur boxing victim is on web3 nonsense, as seen in his experiments with NFTs and forays into crypto, in 2022 he attempted to sell ‚Äúshares‚Äù in the card via Liquid Marketplace. Liquid Marketplace (LM), co-owned by Paul, was an online platform that allowed people to buy an imaginarily-sliced portion of a high-value collectible, and then hope that when it was resold they‚Äôd profit along with the owner. And boy, if you‚Äôd bet ‚ÄúNo‚Äù on Polymarket over whether it would still be in good standing in 2026, you‚Äôd have made a profit. The Canadian government has accused LM of being a ‚Äúmulti-layered fraud,‚Äù saying the company had ‚Äúmisappropriated approximately $3 million, including through hidden payments to shell companies, for the personal enrichment of the LMP Principals.‚Äù (It‚Äôs important to note that Paul was not listed as one of these Principals, and nor does his name appear anywhere within the filing.)

Paul had attempted to sell 51 percent of the Pikachu card on LM, but in the end only sold 5.4 percent for around $270,000. As the company fell apart, and customers began to panic, Paul says he bought the card back for the original price and ensured buyers that their investments could be withdrawn over the next year. In a recent post on Logan Paul‚Äôs X account after the sale, he addressed the controversy noting, ‚ÄúFor reasons outside of my control, the LM site then went offline,‚Äù but claims he then paid to get the site back up and ensured any remaining money could be reclaimed. Oddly, he never mentions his co-ownership of the company at the center of all the problems.

What an epic night. I‚Äôm truly grateful for the Pok√©mon community, Ken Goldin, and my team for making last night a historic moment for the hobby.

To address concerns regarding the ownership history of the card, now for the facts:

I had originally offered to sell up to 51% of the‚Ä¶

‚Äî Logan Paul (@LoganPaul) February 16, 2026

Shiny Cardboard

A couple of other things of note regarding this peculiar sale. First is to address the grading of this particular card. Of the few dozen Illustrator Pikachu cards that PSA has graded, only one has ever received the gold standard of a 10, with 15 managing a 9 and 12 getting a grade 8. But if you look at Paul‚Äôs card, that 10 does feel a little odd. And if you‚Äôve recently tried to get a card graded with the company, you‚Äôll know that something as tiny as an almost invisible print line on the rear of the card is enough to ensure it can‚Äôt score a 10. This is a point well addressed by former Blizzard developer Adam Fletcher in a post on X, where he explains in detail how standards at PSA have risen over the years, and especially so in the last couple. There‚Äôs no way this card would be a 10 if graded today. It makes the whole thing even more of a folly.

Seen so much commentary on this thing. Why not chime in? Has some info on grading/comping cards.

First, Logan Paul is a sleezebag. Won't get into his fractional share nonsense or all his other past behavior but I feel like this is generally known.

As for the card‚Ä¶ I've seen‚Ä¶ https://t.co/UuQtcsXwtr

‚Äî Adam Fletcher (@PezRadar) February 16, 2026

And finally, new owner of the world‚Äôs most expensive piece of cardboard AJ Scaramucci has said that it‚Äôs his wish for the Illustrator Pikachu to be placed in the recently opened Nintendo Museum in Kyoto, Japan, ‚Äúand cement it as the ‚ÄòMona Lisa‚Äô of the Pok√©mon Franchise.‚Äù It seems incredibly unlikely, though, that Nintendo would want to pay the insurance.

Let's get this into the Nintendo Museum in Kyoto and cement it as the "Mona Lisa" of the Pok√©mon Franchise. @Nintendo @Pokemon @Museum_Nintendo pic.twitter.com/SPe56Jo6PB

‚Äî AJ Scaramucci (@jedimooch) February 17, 2026



https://kotaku.com/logan-paul-illustrator-pikachu-polymarket-betting-bidding-2000671967

item.title: World of Warcraft Midnight Release Date & Exact Start Times
item.content:encoded:
A major expansion is on the horizon for World of Warcraft players with the long-awaited release of Midnight, with the release date for WoW Midnight now right around the corner.

The release date for the expansion was first revealed back in November, meaning fans have been ticking down the hours waiting for the next big slew of content in the Blizzard masterpiece.

If you‚Äôre eagerly awaiting the WoW Midnight release date, Insider Gaming has all the important details.

When is WoW Midnight Coming Out? Release Date, Explained

World of War Midnight is set for release on Monday, February 2, so the countdown to launch is well and truly on.

Midnight brings the long-awaited arrival of housing to WoW, something players have been clamouring for, and it‚Äôs expected to be a busy release period. Naturally, that may come alongside server stress, so prepare yourself for potential problems.

  • More Insider Gaming: Does Slay The Spire 2 Early Access Have Multiplayer?

WoW has the capacity to deal with the majority of server stress issues, however, so there shouldn‚Äôt be too many major problems.

When is WoW Midnight Early Access?

Early access for World of Warcraft Midnight is set for Thursday, February 26, giving players an extra weekend to dive into all the brand-new content.

Like many other games, however, entry to early access comes at a cost, as it requires an additional purchase. Given the cost of maintaining WoW access, players may want to consider holding out for the full release.

What Are The WoW Midnight Start Times?

WoW Midnight is set to be released at 3 PM on March 2, with the early access launch coming four days earlier at the same time.

That means a late afternoon launch for those in the United States, while those in Europe face a late night. Meanwhile, those in Asia and Oceania have to wait until the next day.

The exact release times have been shared by Blizzard and are available in the table below. We‚Äôve separated the main release time and early access into different columns.

What is the first thing you‚Äôre planning to do in World of Warcraft Midnight? Share your plans in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For your next read, check out Windrose surpassing one million Steam wishlists, and why the Saints Row director believes the franchise is dead.

item.title: Star Trek: Voyager - Across the Unknown Sales Top 100k in Four Days
item.content:encoded:
Narrative-driven survival game Star Trek: Voyager - Across the Unknown has managed to reach a big sales milestone within its first four days on release, according to a new report.

As reported by German news publication Games Wirtschaft (which was spotted by ResetEra user Nerun), the game, which is published by Daedalic Entertainment, has hit 100,000 sales in under a week.

We're using machine translation for the article, but in it, Daedalic says Across the Unknown marks the "most successful console launch" in its history. In another Games Wirtschaft piece (for which, again, we're using machine translation), Daedalic seems to suggest the game is the most successful launch in its history, period.

A quick look at SteamDB's stats for Daedalic as a publisher suggests that Across the Unknown hasn't achieved its highest peak concurrent player count on PC yet, although there's plenty of time for it to do so.

It's certainly Daedalic's most successful PC launch within the last few years, at any rate; the only game to rival it within the last three years is Barotrauma, which achieved a peak player count of just under 20,000 upon its exit from Early Access in March 2023.

The publisher arguably sorely needs a success like this; while Barotrauma proved a success in 2023, that same year's The Lord of the Rings: Gollum was so disastrous for Daedalic that it closed down its development division following the game's failure.

Since then, things haven't exactly been rosy for Daedalic. Let's hope this one continues to sell well and keeps everyone at the studio in a job.

Star Trek: Voyager - Across the Unknown is available now for PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and Nintendo Switch 2. Stay tuned for more on this and all other things Daedalic Entertainment as and when we get them.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He‚Äôs originally an‚Ä¶ More about Joseph



https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/star-trek-voyager-across-unknown-sales-100k

item.title: Does Slay The Spire 2 Early Access Have Multiplayer? Co-Op & Multiplayer, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Slay The Spire 2 is ready to enter Early Access, just like its predecessor did all those years ago. It‚Äôs the perfect time to take on community feedback and balance the various cards and characters, but there‚Äôs one thing on everyone‚Äôs mind‚Äîwill the sequel have multiplayer?

It was one of the most requested features for the original Slay The Spire, and for good reason; who wouldn‚Äôt want to ascend the Spire with their friends? Well, now‚Äôs the time to find out whether Mega Crit took on the fan feedback, and to see whether Slay The Spire 2 will have multiplayer during Early Access.

Does Slay The Spire 2 Early Access Have Multiplayer?

Yes, Slay The Spire 2 will have multiplayer during Early Access, as you and up to three friends can face the Spire together.

This is thanks to the brand new online Co-Op mode, which brings a whole new level of complexity to the game. From multiplayer exclusive cards to powerful team synergies, you and your friends can work together to ascend the Spire and beat the game.

  • More Insider Gaming: 8 Biggest Indie Games Coming In 2026

Of course, this is brand new to Slay The Spire 2, with the original game not having any form of multiplayer or co-op available. Whilst you can still play the game solo, there‚Äôs no denying that strategizing with three friends will be a thrill like no other‚Äîbut can you do it from the same device?

Does Slay The Spire 2 Early Access Have Split-Screen Co-Op?

At the moment, it doesn‚Äôt seem like Slay The Spire 2 will have split-screen co-op during Early Access.

Mega Crit have only mentioned that the game will have online co-op, and there remains no mention as to whether there will be anything to do with split-screen. However, the likelihood is that whilst it remains in Early Access, co-op features will remain exclusively online.

  • More Insider Gaming: What Is Pok√©mon Pokopia?

That‚Äôs not to say that it won‚Äôt change in the future, though. As the game rolls out on different platforms once Early Access is complete, there‚Äôs a chance that local multiplayer features could be added. Until then, though, you‚Äôll have to team up with your friends across different devices.

Will you be teaming up with anyone to take on the Spire? If you‚Äôre looking for someone to battle alongside, why not look for some friends in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server?

For more Insider Gaming content, check out the differences between Pok√©mon Fire Red and Leaf Green.

item.title: Today‚Äôs Strands #722 Hints and Answers for February 23, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Strands is a daily word search puzzle game from The New York Times. It is a relatively new game, launched in 2024, in which players seek a common theme among words in a 6√ó8 letter grid.

Whether it‚Äôs your first time playing or you‚Äôre a Strands veteran, today‚Äôs tips and strategies can help you find words faster. So, if you‚Äôve found yourself stuck with today‚Äôs Strands, don‚Äôt worry, below you‚Äôll find some helpful hints and even the answers for Strands Game #722 for Monday, February 23, 2026

To play today‚Äôs Strands, head to the game‚Äôs website.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today‚Äôs edition of Strands. If you don‚Äôt want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Strands

Strands is a daily word search that challenges you to find words with a common theme. There‚Äôs also a Spanagram that reveals the deeper theme behind the words.

  • Words that are three letters and under do not count.
  • Words that reveal the correct theme appear in blue.
  • The Spanagram turns yellow when found.
  • Finding three words that don‚Äôt fit the theme will reveal a hint to help you find the proper words.

The goal is to string together as many words as possible. Every letter on the grid gets used! Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Strands can only be played on the New York Times website. You can also play on the NYT Games app.

Strands Hints For Today, February 23, 2026

The Strands‚Äô answers for Game #722 are all related to a very specific musical instrument. Think Johnny Cash, Elvis Presley, and Jimi Hendrix. If you‚Äôre a wrestling fan, think Jeff Jarrett, the Honky Tonk Man, and Elias. Bear in mind that the answers are all generic things in relation to the instrument.

General Strands Hints For February 23

Without giving today‚Äôs Strands answers completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: The spanagram and overarching theme for today‚Äôs puzzle is an instrument that can produce quite emotional pieces of music. The Beatles even believed these instruments could weep.
  • Hint 2: Giraffes are known for these.
  • Hint 3: Some musicians need to be taken down a few of these.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Strands #722 for February 23, 2026.

Words to Help You Find Strand Hints for February 23, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today‚Äôs Strands answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you unlock some in-game hints. A few starter words that may help are:

  • NOTE
  • ROAD
  • BOAR
  • STOCK
  • RIDGE

Today‚Äôs Strands Answer For Game #722 On February 23, 2026

If you‚Äôve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answers to today‚Äôs Strands below. Check out the answers for yesterday‚Äôs puzzle here.

  • PEGS
  • BRIDGE
  • STRING
  • FRETBOARD
  • HEADSTOCK
  • NECK
  • SPANAGRAM: GUITAR

If you solved today‚Äôs Strands without our answers, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow‚Äôs puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

When Is The Next Strands Game After #722?

All New York Times games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before, giving players a heads-up. The game on February 24 will be Strands Game #723.

What Is Strands?

Strands is a daily word search puzzle game created by The New York Times. Launched in 2024, Strands challenges players to discover a common theme among words in a 6√ó8 letter grid. The game‚Äôs original concept was developed by Juliette Seive, a research director on The New York Times Games team, with the aim of replicating Wordle‚Äôs success. Tracy Bennett serves as the puzzle editor for Strands, overseeing the creation and curation of daily puzzles since its launch.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

MOBILE APP

Real-time news, exclusive podcasts, push alerts, and a better reading experience.

Available on iOS & Android

item.title: New Evangelion series by NieR creator Yoko Taro announced
item.content:encoded:
A brand-new Evangelion series written by NieR series creator Yoko Taro and scored by NieR composer Keiichi Okabe is currently in production, animation studios Studio Khara and CloverWorks announced on the final day of the ‚ÄúEvangelion:30+; 30th Anniversary of Evangelion‚Äù festival today.

The series‚Äô staff includes:

  • Series Composition and Script: Yoko Taro
  • Director: Kazuya Tsurumaki, Toko Yatabe
  • Composer: Keiichi Okabe
  • Production: Studio Khara x CloverWorks

Further information was not announced.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/new-evangelion-series-by-nier-creator-yoko-taro-announced

item.title: "I pray they are cursed to never play the game again" Resident Evil 2 director Hideki Kamiya goes off on Resident Evil Requiem leakers
item.content:encoded:
Resident Evil Requiem is almost here, but that hasn't stopped evildoers from dropping lots of spoilers all over the Internet, prompting Capcom to acknowledge the situation ahead of the final weekend before the game's launch. Meanwhile, Resident Evil 2 director (and famous games industry bad boy) Hideki Kamiya had stronger words for the leakers.

Through his X/Twitter account, the creative commented on the ongoing drama and launched a personal attack against the folks who are ruining other fans' fun before the game hits both the shelves and digital storefronts. GamesRadar+ translated the post, but you can find the original one below:

Á¢∫„Åã„Éê„Ç§„Ç™2„ÅÆÊôÇ„ÇÇÁµÇÁõ§„ÅÆÂ±ïÈñã„ÇíÂÜôÁúüÈÄ±ÂàäË™å„Å´„Çπ„ÉÉ„ÉëÊäú„Åã„Çå„Åü„Çà„Å™„Éº‚Ä¶
„ÉÜ„É°„Ç®ÂÄã‰∫∫„ÅÆÂà©Â∑±ÁöÑ„Å™Ê∫ÄË∂≥„ÅÆ„Åü„ÇÅ„Å´„ÄÅÊ•Ω„Åó„Åø„Å´„Åó„Å¶„Çã„É¶„Éº„Ç∂„Éº„ÅÆÊ∞óÊåÅ„Å°„ÇÇ„ÄÅÂäõ„ÇíÂ∞Ω„Åè„Åó„Å¶Âà∂‰Ωú„Åó„Åü„ÇØ„É™„Ç®„Ç§„Çø„Éº„ÅÆÊ∞óÊåÅ„Å°„ÇÇË∏è„ÅøË∫ô„Çã„ÄÅÂÖ®„Å¶„ÅÆ‰∫∫„ÅÆÂπ∏„Åõ„ÇíÁ†¥Â£ä„Åô„ÇãÂîæÊ£Ñ„Åô„Åπ„ÅçË°åÁÇ∫„Åß„ÄÅ‰∏áÊ≠ª„Å´ÂÄ§„Åô„Çã„Å†„Çç‚Ä¶‰∫åÂ∫¶„Å®„Ç≤„Éº„É†„ÇíÈÅä„Åπ„Å™„ÅÑÂë™„ÅÑ„Å´„Åã„Åã„Çå‚Ä¶ https://t.co/iKueo8axFC

‚Äî Á•ûË∞∑Ëã±Ê®πüçÄ Hideki KamiyaüçÄ (@HidekiKamiya_X) February 21, 2026

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

First, he pointed out RE2 actually went through something similar due to a magazine's poor handling of pre-release leaks: "Towards the end of development on Resident Evil 2, I'm sure there were some leaks that were exposed in a weekly magazine." Mind you, being aware of leaks (and even resharing them) isn't uncommon these days, but things were different back in the day. Still, actual plot spoilers, especially so close to a game's release, are in bad taste in my opinion.

Regardless, the RE Requiem leaks are coming from less official sources and aren't a matter of an outlet slipping up. Thus, cracking down on the leakers is far more difficult. Kamiya said there's almost nothing to gain from leaks that ultimately hurt those who worked hard on the games: "Trampling on the feelings of the people who are looking forward to the game, and the creatives who worked so hard to make it... Destroying everyone's joy, just for these assholes' self-gratification."

Towards the end of his port, the developer's meaner side reappeared: "Should you commit these contemptible acts, you deserve to die ten thousand deaths," he declared before going with a softer alternative that's just praying "they are cursed to never play the game again."

It must be noted Kamiya is a much friendlier individual in person, but he's well-known for his harsh attitude online, one which, if you ask me, is often justified based on who/what he often has to deal with.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/resident-evil-2-director-hideki-kamiya-blasts-requiem-leakers

item.title: Slay The Spire 2 Early Access Release Date & Exact Start Times
item.content:encoded:
The sequel to the incredibly popular deck-building roguelike Slay The Spire was officially announced back in April, 2024, and now almost two years later, its release date has officially been announced.

However, that comes with a major caveat: Slay The Spire 2 is first releasing in Early Access, with an official full release date still unconfirmed. But if you‚Äôre eager to tackle the mysteries of the Spire, then you won‚Äôt have to wait long, as Early Access is right around the corner.

What Is The Slay The Spire 2 Early Access Release Date?

Mega Crit announced that Slay The Spire 2 will enter Early Access on March 5, 2026, though the full release date remains unknown.

Whilst it might sound confusing to some, the original Slay The Spire was actually released in the same way. It arrived in Early Access, and after almost two years‚Äô worth of community-led finetuning and balancing, the game was officially released as the complete package.

  • More Insider Gaming: What Is Pok√©mon Pokopia?

Mega Crit mentioned on Slay The Spire 2‚Äôs Steam page that they expect to follow a similar schedule with the sequel. So, if all goes according to plan, Slay The Spire 2 should ideally officially launch as a complete package by late 2027 or early 2028. Of course, these dates are speculation, so don‚Äôt put too much trust in them, but fingers crossed that it arrives sooner rather than later.

Slay The Spire 2 Early Access Start Times

You‚Äôll want to be up and ready in the morning, as Slay The Spire 2 will be launching in Early Access on Steam at 10 AM PT on March 5.

  • More Insider Gaming: 8 Biggest Indie Games Coming In 2026

Of course, not everyone diving into Slay The Spire 2‚Äôs Early Access will be native to the PT time zone, so for everybody else, Insider Gaming has adjusted the release time for your convenience. If you don‚Äôt see your time zone, let a staff member know, and it‚Äôll be added!

Are you excited to try out the Slay The Spire 2 Early Access? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more Insider Gaming content, check out the Marathon release date and start times, as well as the Pok√©mon Pokopia release date and start times.

item.title: God of War Ragnarok Drops to Just $20 in PlayStation's Brand New Sale on PS5 Games
item.content:encoded:
That matches its excellent Black Friday discount as well.

PlayStation‚Äôs Direct store is holding a huge sale on PS5 games, accessories, and more, helping you fill out the gaps in your collection, and one of the big beneficiaries of this is Kratos himself.

God of War‚Äôs latest mainline entry, God of War Ragnarok, has been discounted by a whopping 71% at PlayStation Direct, dropping to just $19.99, while Best Buy is matching the price as well.

God of War Raganrok

That's $50 in savings, and well worth picking up over playing via PlayStation Plus (at least in my opinion), especially if you want to take your sweet time with what is a genuine masterpiece.

The game picks up after the events of the 2018 reboot of the series, which took Kratos from Greek mythology to his new life, where he‚Äôs raising his son, Atreus. After revelations about the place of both in the wider pantheon, Ragnarok is packed with unforgettable moments.

In IGN's review, Simon Cardy awarded the game a 10/10, calling it an ‚Äúenthralling spectacle to behold‚Äù.

‚ÄúImpeccable writing, pitch-perfect performances, knockout action ‚Äì it‚Äôs a complete work of art from top to bottom. Reflecting its core themes, it's everything a sequel should be: respectful of its legendary lineage, but not afraid to take it to exciting new places.‚Äù

Couldn‚Äôt have put it better myself, and now‚Äôs a great time to jump on board ahead of the remake of the Ghost of Sparta‚Äôs earliest adventures, which were recently confirmed to be in development (but are likely some ways off yet).

Kratos isn‚Äôt alone, either. Other discounts include almost 30% off of 2025‚Äôs Ghost of Yotei, essentially marking its first sizeable discount, as well as deals on the likes of Helldivers 2, Stellar Blade, Spider-Man 2, and many more.

There are even controllers on sale, including the limited Death Stranding 2 pad - but you'll likely want to move fast for that one.

Lloyd Coombes is an experienced freelancer in tech, gaming and fitness seen at Polygon, Eurogamer, Macworld, TechRadar and many more. He's a big fan of Magic: The Gathering and other collectible card games, much to his wife's dismay.

Recommends

In This Article

item.title: Even though many developers are being laid off, consumer spending in gaming was actually up in January 2026, new report reveals
item.content:encoded:
Subscription services are behind the boost.

The vibes are rotten out there if you work anywhere near video games. 2026 is yet another year off to a terrible start when it comes to layoffs, project cancellations, and studio closures that often don't make a lick of sense. Despite all this, though, US consumer spending on video games has gone up year-on-year.

Via GamesIndustry.biz, we've gotten a quick look at Circana's latest data on console and PC content spending during January 2026. The year-on-year rise was of 3% (getting it to $4.3 billion by last month). "This growth was driven by a 23% increase in non-mobile subscription services, generating $596 million in revenue." We'd been hearing for a while that, even after price increases across the board, premium subscription services were driving a lot of growth these days, and the data continues to back those assessments up.

"Hardware spend reached $248 million, up 16% compared to January 2025" despite PS5 (down 17%), Xbox Series X/S (down 27%), and Nintendo Switch (down 79%) all seeing substantial year-on-year declines. It's all explained by Nintendo Switch 2's strong launch period and hold despite a slower-than-desirable Christmas season. PS5 continued to be leading in the US market, though.

Perhaps more shocking (at least to disgruntled Call of Duty fans and outsiders) is that Black Ops 7 has been topping the charts during the January 2026 period. Its initial launch was well below Microsoft and Xbox's high expectations, but we're talking about CoD here, and the IP continues to be the rival to beat in the FPS space. It was followed by NBA 2K26, Madden NFL 26, and Minecraft. "Battlefield 6 dropped from No. 3 to No. 5" but continues to perform strongly after its killer launch back in October.

Other highlights include Final Fantasy 7 Remake sneaking into the Top 10 (from way down at No. 255!) after the release of its fantastic Nintendo Switch 2 and Xbox Series X/S ports. Shocking few gamers, "Fallout 4 just made it into the Top 20, rising from No.68 after the second season of Prime Video's adaptation." Chances are the modern RPG classic will get another boost after its Switch 2 port arrives tomorrow, 24th February.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/january-2026-us-consumer-spending-on-video-games-was-up

item.title: Xbox's new head of gaming has "no tolerance for bad AI", following concerns about the proliferation of AI slop, and Sharma's tech background
item.content:encoded:
"Great stories are created by humans."

Microsoft's new gaming CEO Asha Sharma has responded to concerns surrounding her background in AI, as well as her lack of previous gaming-related roles.

Sharma was announced to be taking over from Phil Spencer following Friday's shock news that the Xbox head would be retiring from Microsoft after nearly 40 years with the company. Sarah Bond, who many had presumed would eventually succeed Spencer, also announced she would be leaving Xbox at this same time.

When word came out that Sharma would be taking over as Xbox's head of gaming, many raised concerns about her background in AI (Sharma was previously Microsoft's president of CoreAI). However, Sharma has now seeked to calm these concerns, stating to Variety she has "no tolerance" for what she classifies as "bad" AI.

"AI has long been part of gaming and will continue to be," Sharma told the publication, stating that industry needs new "growth engines". That said, the new Xbox head added "great stories are created by humans", and not by machines.

As for her lack of professional roles within the gaming sector specifically, on the announcement of her new position Sharma made "three commitments" to the Xbox community: "Great games", the "return of Xbox", and the "future of play". She has since affirmed that she wants Xbox to tell stories that make people "feel something" when they play, complete with "deep emotional resonance" and a "distinct point of view". Sharma cited Campo Santo's 2016 first-person mystery Firewatch as a game that had this kind of impact on her.

Sharma admitted she had "a lot to learn" in her new role within the gaming industry, however she is committed to "being grounded in what the community is telling" Xbox. "I'm coming into gaming as a platform builder," she said, with her goal to "earn the right to be trusted by players and developers". She will do this by demonstrating "consistency" over time, Sharma added.

We can expect to hear more about what Xbox has in store next month, during the annual GDC conference, Sharma said, before teasing some bigger announcements to come during an Xbox Games Showcase this spring.

For more, over the weekend Sarah Bond shared her farewell to Xbox staff, where said she will "remain on as a Special Advisor to Asha to help ensure a smooth transition," but stressed, "this is the right time for me to take my next step, both personally and professionally".

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/xboxs-new-head-of-gaming-has-no-tolerance-for-bad-ai-following-concerns-about-the-proliferation-of-ai-slop-and-sharmas-tech-background

item.title: "They've ghosted me": Saints Row design director says he believes the series is "dead" after pitching prequel
item.content:encoded:
"I get the sense that Embracer has zero ability to do anything with it"

Make sure the dildos are flying at half mast. Saints Row 1 design director Chris Stockman has said he believes the series is "dead", following conversations with Embracer Group about his pitch for a prequel. According to the developer, who currently heads VR studio Bit Planet Games, that chatter about a potential Saints Rowssurection post Embracer's closing of Volition has ended in the publishers ghosting Stockman.

Stockman's pitch for a Saints Row comeback - revolving around a trip back to the 70s to unearth how the series' gangs came to be via an adventure with a similar tone to the series first couple of entries - gained traction online late last year. The developer subsequently revealed current series owners Embracer had expressed interest in hearing him out on it.

Sadly, the latest updates Stockman's offered in chats on Bit Planet's Discord server (spotted by Europeanvideogamer) don't paint a very rosy picture in terms of how his resuscitation efforts are working out. "I think the franchise is dead, unfortunately," he told one user during a January exchange. "I get the sense that Embracer has zero ability to do anything with it. I wish things were different. I tried my best to offer a path forward but they've ghosted me."

Also, in case you were wondering, Stockman isn't sure whether Saints Row newslady Jane Valderamma was based on Family Guy newslady Tricia Takanawa. I didn't need to tell you that, but it was the subject of that January Discord chat immediately prior to Stockman dropping the bombshell that he thinks Saints Row's gone the way of the dodo. Boy, sometimes things escalate quickly.

For what it's worth, the developer's subsequently emphasised in a comment on February 17th that the ball is still very much in Embracer's court if they want to license or contract the Saints Row series out to his studio. However, he says he's "done all I can do to try and make that happen".

So, things are looking bleak if you're holding out for a dildo-batless revival for Saints Row headed up by some series veterans.

item.title: Wordscapes Daily Puzzle Hints Today‚ÄîAnswers For Monday, February 23
item.content:encoded:
Wordscapes is a popular word game where players solve a crossword using anagrams, and it also features a Daily Puzzle, which is not the easiest to solve at times.

If you are one of the players who is struggling with the latest Wordscapes Daily Puzzle, then don‚Äôt worry, as Insider Gaming has all the hints and answers for the puzzle featured on Monday, February 23.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today‚Äôs edition of the Wordscapes Daily Puzzle. If you don‚Äôt want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How to Play Wordscapes

Wordscapes is a relatively easy game to play, but it can become increasingly challenging as you advance. In the game, players are presented with a crossword puzzle to solve using an anagram. The anagram is displayed below the crossword, and players must swipe across the letters to form words.

The game features over 6,000 crossword puzzles for players to solve. More points can be unlocked by finding hidden words, and each level also comes with a beautiful landscape background. The game is available for free download on both the Google Play Store and the iOS App Store.

Wordscapes Daily Puzzle Clues (Feb. 23)

Here are hints for all the Wordscapes Daily Puzzle answers for February 23, 2026, to make your puzzle a bit easier.

Across

  1. Greatest in number or amount.
  2. To rest on a chair.
  3. A bed for a baby.
  4. A genre of video games, for example, Flight ‚Äì _ _ _.
  5. Formation of a cloud through very small drops of water.
  6. Suffers without complaining.

Down

  1. Something that is slightly wet/damp.
  2. A comedy series with characters in different amusing situations each week.
  3. The price of something.
  4. Another way to write ‚Äúit is‚Äù.
  5. To leave something out.
  6. Belonging to a thing.
  7. A sudden, quick movement in the muscle.

All Wordscapes Daily Puzzle Answers (Feb. 23)

Here are all the answers for Wordscapes Daily Puzzle on February 23, 2026, if the hints were not enough for you.

Across 

  1. MOST
  2. SIT
  3. COT
  4. SIM
  5. MIST
  6. STOIC

Down

  1. MOIST
  2. SITCOM
  3. COST
  4. TIS
  5. OMIT
  6. ITS
  7. TIC

When is the Next Wordscapes Daily Puzzle?

The next daily puzzle will be updated at 12 AM local time, with the next, for February 24, arriving tomorrow.

What are your thoughts on today‚Äôs Wordscapes Daily Puzzle? Did you find it difficult or easy? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more word games, check out hints and answers for today‚Äôs Quordle #1491, and take a look at hints for today‚Äôs NYT Mini Crossword.

item.title: Report: Tencent quietly shutters Timi Montreal
item.content:encoded:
Chris Kerr,

Senior Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

February 23, 2026

1 Min Read

Image via Tencent / TiMi Studios Group

Tencent appears to have shuttered Timi Montreal around five years after establishing the studio to create an original triple-A franchise. 

As reported by Game File, a (now-deleted) LinkedIn post from a former employee indicated the studio has been shut down. Game File reporter Stephen Totilo explained multiple sources had previously stated a shutdown was imminent. 

Timi Studios Group is the Tencent subsidiary responsible for developing and operating notable tiles such as Call of Duty: Mobile, Honor of Kings, and Pokemon Unite. 

The division is headquartered in Shenzhen, China, but also had offices in Los Angeles, Seattle, Shanghai, and Chengdu back in 2021‚Äîwhen Tencent announced the opening of its new Montreal location. The LA studio, Team Kajiu, was shuttered by Tencent in 2023. 

The Montreal team was specifically tasked with developing an "ambitious AAA, service-driven open-world game across multiple platforms," but it's currently unclear what happened to that project. 

Related:Embark Studios CEO Patrick Soderlund named executive chairman of Nexon

As noted by Game File, Timi Studios only has vacancies at its studios in China at the time of writing. 

Last year, Tencent acquired a 26.32 percent economic stake in new Ubisoft subsidiary Vantage Studios, which will oversee key franchises like Assassin's Creed and Far Cry. The Chinese conglomerate also sunk cash into Lighthouse Games, the UK studio led by Playground Games founder Gavin Raeburn. 

More recently, Tencent subsidiary Sumo Digital announced job cuts for the third successive calendar year. 

About the Author

Senior Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

Game Developer news editor Chris Kerr is an award-winning reporter with over a decade of experience in the game industry. His byline has appeared in notable print and digital publications including Edge, Stuff, Wireframe, International Business Times, and PocketGamer.biz. Throughout his career, Chris has covered major industry events including GDC, PAX Australia, Gamescom, Paris Games Week, and Develop Brighton. 



https://www.gamedeveloper.com/business/report-tencent-shutters-timi-montreal
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Elon Musk's Grok reportedly had an update delayed thanks to its lacklustre Baldur's Gate 3 knowledge
item.content:encoded:
It's also being taught how to play League of Legends, according to Business Insider.

Grok, the generative AI chatbot on X (formerly Twitter), reportedly had an update delay because it wasn't a good enough expert on Baldur's Gate 3. This came from its owner Elon Musk, who apparently was dissatisfied with his non-consentual nude creating, formerly Hitler-praising, tool.

This report comes from Business Insider, which published a report into xAI following Musk's shift from head of the US Government's Department of Government Efficiency back to his prior role as CEO at various tech-based companies.

Business Insider wrote: "a model release was delayed for several days because Musk was dissatisfied with how the chatbot answered detailed questions about the video game 'Baldur's Gate,' according to people familiar with the matter."

Sources also told Business Insider that Musk had requested Grok learning about League of Legends - one of his favourite games - a priority. To achieve this, Musk brought together a group of staff into a "war room", as Business Insider claims he does whenever there's a problem he deems urgent. One of these war room groups was dedicated to getting the impressionable AI chatbot to play perhaps the most toxic game of all time.

What is the purpose of having an generative AI chatbot play a game for you, who knows? Years ago, before the generative AI boom, one program was able to beat Dota 2 players after training on 3,500 hours of gameplay. So it's not like this idea is particularly novel either.

If you're in the UK, your parliament recently discussed the dissemination of sexually explicit and non-consensual images due to Grok's recent behavior. This may lead to expansions of the Online Safety Act, so that it covers the output of AI chat bots.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/elon-musks-grok-reportedly-had-an-update-delayed-thanks-to-its-lacklustre-baldurs-gate-3-knowledge
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: The latest update on the BioShock movie states "Netflix and Take-Two are very anxious" to line it up with the new game's release
item.content:encoded:
Somewhere beyond the sea.

It's been a while since the BioShock movie was revived... only be stuck in limbo again. Slow progress is being made on a script, however, and like many suspected, it seems that director Francis Lawrence's busy agenda has been the main thing preventing it from happening.

Since Netflix's take on the cursed project was announced in February 2022, Lawrence has been busy working on two different Hunger Games prequels, The Long Walk, and even the tentative sequels to I Am Legend and Constantine. Now, via Collider, producer Roy Lee has teased BioShock could be the filmmaker's next big project after he's done with The Hunger Games: Sunrise on the Reaping's post-production later this year.

"We would have gotten it made a few years back, but then other movies got in the way, with one being The Long Walk and the other being The Hunger Games prequel, which comes out this December. We're just waiting for him to finish post-production, because he's going to be working on it through at least September, and then jump back into it," Lee openly admitted during a chat with Collider's Steve Weintraub. Many cinephiles and video game fans figured this could be the case, especially with the I Am Legend and Constantine sequels being far from locked, but it's reassuring to get a proper update from BioShock's producer.

Netflix and rights-holder Take-Two might also be pushing hard to get the ball rolling on the long-in-the-works adaptation pronto, as the fourth game in the series might get a nice boost after former Gears of War and Diablo head Rod Fergusson joined Cloud Chamber last year to rework and fast-track its troubled development. Fergusson is no stranger to coming in hot to fix and finally release troublesome games, and it seems the powers that be are betting on the game being ready in the coming years, which is why the movie needs to get going soon: "I know that Netflix and Take-Two are very anxious to see the movie come out because they want to have the release coincide with some of the potential new incarnations of the game," Lee added.

After last year's creative shakeup at 2K and Cloud Chamber, we also learned a remake of the original BioShock was in development and ultimately binned according to reports. That would've been the perfect thing to release alongside a live-action movie, but now all eyes are on the all-new fourth BioShock... even if we don't know anything about its nature yet.

BioShock

iOS, PS3, Xbox 360, PlayStation Vita, PC, Mac

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/bioshock-movie-update-take-two-and-netflix-want-release-alongside-bioshock-4
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Ubisoft CEO touts ‚Äúdisciplined workforce management‚Äù while defending giving his son the keys to Assassin's Creed
item.content:encoded:
New AC and Far Cry games on the way, confirms Yves Guillemot

Ubisoft‚Äôs CEO Yves Guillemot has confirmed that they are making a bunch of new Assassin‚Äôs Creed and Far Cry games, together with some unannounced original projects, in a wide-ranging albeit very rehearsed-sounding chinwag with Variety.

In the interview, Guillemot also talked more about Ubisoft‚Äôs plan to cut fixed costs by ‚Ç¨200 million, as the publishers continue their transformation into a set of ‚Äúcreative houses‚Äù grouped around particular games and genres. The transformation has already led to the cancellation of several games and the closure of two studios, and it sounds like there could be more layoffs on the way.

‚ÄúAs we announced, the ‚Ç¨200 million in additional cost reductions will include selective restructuring across the company,‚Äù Guilemot told the site. ‚ÄúThat said, our primary focus for aligning the organization with our long-term goals remains disciplined workforce management, meaning prioritizing voluntary departures while carefully controlling recruitment for replacements and new roles.

‚ÄúWe are also taking a range of measures to optimize the business: reducing certain expenses, adjusting or stopping projects where necessary, improving production processes, and making more effective use of our tools,‚Äù he went on.

‚ÄúFollowing the post-Covid period, the industry grew very quickly, anticipating sustained demand that didn‚Äôt fully materialize. On our part, this led to too many projects and increased complexity. Our priority today is to build a more focused, agile company, with stronger teams that strike the right balance between senior expertise and young talent and who are well positioned to deliver the highest quality games.‚Äù

The talk of ‚Äúdisciplined workforce management‚Äù might seem a bit risible when you consider that Yves has just appointed his son, Charlie, as co-CEO of Vantage Studios, the creative house that will handle potential ‚Äúbillionaire brands‚Äù like Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry and Rainbow Six.

Charlie Guillemot has a few years under his belt in executive positions, but doesn‚Äôt strike me as anybody‚Äôs first choice for the role of Assassin‚Äôs Cry Rainbows tsar. As PCGamer note, he‚Äôs otherwise known for running free-to-play specialists Owlient, creators of an infamous Tom Clancy mobile spin-off that shut down a year after launch, and co-founding AI, web3 and blockchain studio Unagi. Charlie Guillemot doesn‚Äôt have any public credits on any of Ubisoft‚Äôs would-be ‚Äúbillionaire brands‚Äù.

Vantage‚Äôs other co-CEO, Christophe Derennes, looks like a stronger fit: he‚Äôs the former general manager of Ubisoft Montr√©al, developers of the original Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry 2 and several Rainbow Six games.

Ubisoft ‚Äì founded by the Guillemot brothers in 1986 - have batted away allegations of nepotism in the past. Asked by Variety to comment on the subject yet again, Guillemot replied that ‚ÄúUbisoft was created as a family company, and our strong heritage helps us take a long-term view, prioritizing sustainable growth, creative ambition, and continuity over short-term cycles. This perspective guides our decisions and helps us build franchises, teams, and strategies that endure for decades.‚Äù

I‚Äôm not sure the argument that keeping it in the family helps Ubi avoid short-termism really gels with the previous answer about over-expansion during the Covid boom, or with Ubisoft‚Äôs repeated investments in NFTs and other flavours of snakeoil.

‚ÄúI strongly believe that Christophe Derennes and Charlie are the right leaders as Co-CEOs of Vantage Studios,‚Äù Guillemot went on. ‚ÄúThey bring complementary strengths and experience that make them well-suited for the role. Their appointment was based on their skills, track record, and fit for the role.‚Äù

Ubisoft‚Äôs creative houses ‚Äúwill operate like dedicated business units with clear accountability for performance and genuine creative autonomy,‚Äù the exec explained. Vantage specifically have funding from Tencent, but according to Guillemot, the latter ‚Äúrespect our operational autonomy and are not involved in our governance or day-to-day management‚Äù.

Whether investors trust the Guillemots to run Ubisoft any longer is somewhat in doubt: the company has weathered shareholder revolts over the falling stock price. The Guillemots have also been accused of failing to curb a "boy's club" workplace culture that has led to several criminal convictions. I get the sense that decentralising the founding fathers and detoxifying the Ubisoft brand is part of the thinking behind positioning the creative houses as autonomous. Or at least, that was my reasoning before the big boss appointed his son to co-run three of Ubisoft‚Äôs most successful series.

They‚Äôll have to do more than that to convince the Ubisoft rank-and-file: around 1200 French Ubisoft workers went on strike earlier this month in response to the changes of direction and an associated return-to-office policy.



https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/ubisoft-ceo-touts-disciplined-workforce-management-while-defending-giving-his-son-the-keys-to-assassins-creed
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Today‚Äôs Quordle #1491: All Answers & Hints For February 23, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Quordle takes the complexity of the original daily word game and ups the ante by having you solve four solutions at once. Your 100% attention suddenly needs to be diverted four ways, and completing the daily Quordle is tough without the right starting words or hints. February 23, 2026, Quordle is the #1491 edition of the puzzle, and there are four new words for you to find. This guide has hints and a helping hand to help you solve all four words.

Before the information comes thick and fast at you, make sure you give today‚Äôs Quordle a go if you haven‚Äôt already!

How To Play Quordle Daily Word Game

Quordle is different from other daily word games as it requires you to correctly work out four words at once, and you can attempt this through the official Quordle website.

Before anything else, check out this set of instructions on finding and playing Quordle:

  1. Go to the Quordle website.
  2. You should be presented with four equal boxes reminiscent of a Wordle setup.
  3. Enter your first guess using the keyboard input at the bottom of the screen.
  4. The game will fill out the first of nine lines for all four boxes.
  5. A green box means the letter is correct AND goes in that exact spot on the grid.
  6. A yellow box means the letter is correct BUT needs to go in a different spot on the grid.
  7. A grey box means the letter DOESN‚ÄôT feature at all.
  8. Do this up to nine times to try to solve all four words.

Best Quordle Tips & Tricks

  • Try to use as many of the five vowels as you can in your first two guesses.
  • Focus on solving words with more green and yellow boxes first.
  • Avoid reusing letters that are not applicable across any of the four answers.
  • Don‚Äôt be afraid to try the same letter twice in one word, as answers can be sneaky like that.
  • Play the Practice game first if you‚Äôre not used to Quordle, or need a warm-up before today‚Äôs new game!

Quordle Hints For Today, February 23, 2026

Top-left grid

  • Hint 1: To move in a stealthy or slow and animated way.
  • Hint 2: Add a ‚Äúy‚Äù for a fun toy!

Top-right grid

  • Hint 1: ‚ÄúAny of a genus (Rhus) of trees, shrubs, and woody vines of the cashew family that have leaves turning to brilliant colors in the autumn.‚Äù
  • Hint 2: Dried powdered leaves

Bottom-left grid

  • Hint 1: To venture into somewhere.
  • Hint 2: Attempting something new.

Bottom-right grid

  • Hint 1: Edible crustacean.
  • Hint 2: Could go well with a ‚Äòcocktail‚Äô or ‚Äòcrackers.‚Äô

Starter Words For February 23, 2026 Quordle

You should consider using one or more of the following words to get you started with today‚Äôs new Quordle puzzle:

  • Wrang
  • Slack
  • Fluke

SPOILER WARNING: The answers will be revealed next!

All Today‚Äôs Quordle #1491 Answers For February 23, 2026

Get ready for all four of today‚Äôs Quordle answers, starting from the top-left grid, then the top-right, then the bottom-left, and finally the bottom-right.

When Is The Next Quordle Daily Game?

Quordle is updated daily at 12 AM (Midnight) in your time zone and region, so the next game will start on February 24

The Quordle schedule is very consistent and always comes out at the same time each new day.

What Is Quordle?

Quordle is a variation of the popular Wordle daily word game, but instead of giving you one word to solve, you must figure out four unique words at the same time.

Needless to say, Quordle is MUCH harder than Wordle! There are days when it might be an achievement just to solve one of the four words. Whereas you can guess Wordle with your first answer, that‚Äôs impossible with Quordle. You need to be thinking on all cylinders with Quordle, and Insider Gaming strongly recommends you take the hints above on board and apply them to future Quordle puzzles.

Additionally, a new daily guide will be on the website for every new puzzle. Keep coming back each day for hints and solutions to the newest Quordle daily word games!

How did you find today‚Äôs Quordle? If you have any feedback on what you want to see added to these guides, share your thoughts via the free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server.

You should also check out IG‚Äôs other word game guides:

  • NYT Mini Crossword Hints Today‚ÄîAnswers For Monday, February 23
  • Today‚Äôs Contexto #1254: Hints & Answer For February 23, 2026
  • NYT Connections Hints Today (#988)‚ÄîAnswers for Monday, February 23
  • Today‚Äôs Strands #721 Hints and Answers for February 22, 2026

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem Leakers Deserve 'A Thousand Deaths,' Hideki Kamiya Says
item.content:encoded:
"It's a despicable act that destroys the happiness of everyone."

Resident Evil 2's director and famed developer, Hideki Kamiya, has opened up on his thoughts about leaks and spoilers, suggesting those who revel in ruining surprises for others "deserve a thousand deaths" and "be cursed to never be able to play games again."

His thoughts come as Resident Evil Requiem spoilers flood the internet, even though Capcom has promised "firm action" against those responsible. The developer said it believed the "large number of gameplay videos" now floating around the internet ‚Äî some of which contain huge spoilers and clips of the game's finale, which IGN verified as legitimate ‚Äî originated from copies obtained "through illegal means."

Now, in a message posted to Twitter/X and translated by machine (which means there may be some inaccuracies or missing nuance), Kamiya reflected on how spoilers also impacted the release of Resident Evil 2.

"I'm sure the final developments of [Resident Evil 2] were also exposed in a weekly photo magazine‚Ä¶" he wrote. "For your own selfish satisfaction, you trample on the feelings of the users who were looking forward to the game, as well as the feelings of the creators who put all their effort into making it.

"It's a despicable act that destroys the happiness of everyone, and deserves a thousand deaths... May you be cursed to never be able to play games again..."

Capcom stressed the posting of these videos constitutes copyright infringement, as well as generally being "an act that offends other customers." However, the publisher seems somewhat limited in what it can actually do in response, suggesting it will simply delete the videos or issue "warnings."

Thankfully, we don't have long to wait now, as Resident Evil Requiem's February 27 release date is but a few short days away. "After getting hands-on with a total of about four hours of Resident Evil 9 Requiem at this point, and sharing that experience with colleagues, I‚Äôm more excited for the series than I have been in recent memory," IGN wrote after going hands-on with Resident Evil Requiem recently. "It‚Äôs the old mixed with the new, but all in a modern package with two protagonists I already like a lot."

Vikki Blake is a reporter for IGN, as well as a critic, columnist, and consultant with 15+ years experience working with some of the world's biggest gaming sites and publications. She's also a Guardian, Spartan, Silent Hillian, Legend, and perpetually High Chaos. Find her at BlueSky.
